description.en:
The course consists of three modules: 
I - Introductory bioinformatics module
*	In silico analysis of single genes and proteins - basic search algorithms (blast), retrieval options, file types, alignment options, phylogenetic tree building etc. 
*	Design of primers for single genes - PCR primers, cDNA cloning primers 
*	Analysis of genomic regions - enhancers, promoters, coding regions, intron-exon. structure, (alternative) splicing, overlapping genes (including miRNA genes) 
*	Analysis of gene expression data (RNA seq, microarray, protein arrays, chip data). 
*	Analysis of interactome and GO data.
*	Analysis of protein interaction networks.


II - Genome engineering module
*	The Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL):  a community standard for communicating designs in synthetic biology. 
*	Sequence manipulations, genome editing, codon optimization 
*	In silico implementation of synthetic gene networks and functional modules based on genetic information from various species
*	Design of synthetic protein interaction networks using the Short Linear Motif (SLiMs) databases
*	Design of logic gates - outreach to computer engineering
*	In silico protein engineering 
*	Assembly of heterologous biosynthetic pathways in cell factory producer strains and cell lines; integrating across the Design-Build-Test-Cycle.
*	Bioinformatics for the synthetic biology of natural products. 
*	Metabolic modeling of engineered microbial cell factory strains. 

III - Build-a-genome-course pre-planning module:
*	The genome SCRAMBLe method
*	Introduction to the Phosphoprocessors toolbox
*	Design of a chromosome structure and the minichunk recombination strategy
*	Setting up a practical timeline and performing a cost analysis of the chromosome synthesis.
description.et:
Sisu lühikirjeldus 
Kursus koosneb kolmest moodulist:
I - Sissejuhatus bioinformaatikasse.
*	Geenide ja valkude in silico analüüs - peamised otsingualgoritmid (blast), järjestuste andmebaasid, DNA järjestuste failitüübid, alignment analüüs, fülogeneetiliste puude koostamine etc. 
*	PCR-i praimerite disain
*	Genoomi erinevate regioonide analüüs - enhanserid, promootorid, kodeerivad ja mittekodeerivad järjestused, geenide intron-ekson struktuur, (alternative) splicing, kattuvad geenijärjestused (kaasaarvatud miRNA geenid) 
*	Geeniekspressiooni anmete analüüs (RNA seq, microarray, protein arrays, chip data) 
*	Interaktoomi ja GO andmeanalüüs
*	Valk-valk interaktsioonide võrgustike analüüs.

II - Genoomi konstrueerimise moodul
*	The Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL):  a community standard for communicating designs in synthetic biology 
*	DNA järjstusega manipuleerimine, genoomi editing, koodonite optimeerimine
*	In silico sünteetiliste geneetiliste võrkude ja funktsionaalsete moodulite disain ja konstrueerimine lähtudes erinevatest genoomidest pärit algmaterjalidest
*	Sünteetiliste valk-valk interaktsioonide võrgustike disain kasutades Short Linear Motif (SLiMs) andmebaase
*	Loogikaelementide disain - sarnasus arvutitehnoloogiaga
*	In silico valkude disain  
*	Heteroloogiliste biosünteesi radade disain ja sisestamine tootjarakkude genoomi: Design-Build-Test-Cycle
*	Biosünteesi radade bioinformaatika. 
*	Disainerrakuvabrikute metabolismi analüüsi meetodid. 

III - Build-a-Genome-Course ettevalmistav moodul
*	SCRAMBLe meetod genoomi muutmiseks ja suunatud evolutsiooniks
*	Sissejuhatus Phosphoprocessor'ite tehnoloogiasse
*	Kromosoomi struktuuri ja konstrueerimisstrateegia disain
*	Kromosoomi sünteesi praktiline ajakava ja kuluanalüüs.

objectives.en: The main aims of the course are to i) provide a basic general overview of the bioinformatics methods and relevant databases used to analyze digital genetic information and gene regulatory mechanisms; ii) to introduce the general concept and methodology for designing synthetic biological systems via genome engineering; iii) design a synthetic chromosome in silico that will serve as a blueprint for construction of the synthetic chromosome in a connected "build-a-genome-course" within the "LTTI.00.007 Synthetic Biology Laboratory Course".
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk anda üliõpilasele ülevaade peamistest geneetilise informatsiooni analüüsi meetoditest, geeniregulatsiooni mehhanismidest ja olulistest andmebaasidest. Kursuse raames antakse alusteadmised sünteetiliste bioloogiliste süsteemide konstrueerimisest genoomi tasemel. Disainitakse in silico reaalne sünteetiline kromosoom, mille konstrueerimine viiakse läbi loengukursusega seotud sünteetilise bioloogia praktikumis (LTTI.00.007) "build-a-genome-course" süsteemi järgi.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course participants will know relevant databases for biological data (incl. genomic regions, protein domains, protein-protein interactions, gene expression data, Gene Ontology). The course will give an overview of the main bioinformatics methods that the attendee can later use in his/her research projects that involve the analysis of genetic information and/or design of novel genetic circuits. The course offers an alternative to the classical form of bioinformatics courses in terms of additional modules focused on genome engineering and rational design of chromosomes. It also introduces an innovative Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL):  a community standard for communicating designs in synthetic biology.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursus annab ülevaate peamistest bioinformaatika meetoditest, mida kursuse läbinu saab rakendada geneetilise informatsiooni analüüsiks ja uute geneetiliste moodulite ja genoomide disainiks. Kursus erineb klassikalisest bioinformaatika kursusest selle poolest, et lisaks analüüsi meetoditele tutvustatakse ka sünteetiliste geneetiliste võrgustike ja tervete kromosoomide disaini ja konstrueerimise meetodeid ning disainiplatvormi SBOL (Synthetic Biology Open language).

learning_outcomes.en: Participants of the course will receive the following set of skills:
1)	In silico analysis of cellular processes: genetic information and its manifestations.
learning_outcomes.et: 1)	Rakuprotsesside in silico analüüs: geneetiline informatsioon ja selle avaldumine.

learning_outcomes.en: 2)	Ability to apply bioinformatics methods for analysing gene regulation (incl. sequence alignment and analysis, primer design, gene expression analysis, CRISPR).
learning_outcomes.et: 2)	Oskus kasutada geeniregulatsiooni uurimiseks vajalikke meetodeid (s.h. järjestuste joondus ja analüüs, praimerite disain, geeniekspressiooni analüüs, CRISPR)

learning_outcomes.en: 3)	Will know relevant databases for biological data (incl. genomic regions, protein domains, protein-protein interactions, gene expression data, Gene Ontology).
learning_outcomes.et: 3)	Oskus kasutada bioloogilisi andmebaase (s.h. genoomsed piirkonnad, valkude domeenid, valkude vahelised interaktsioonid, ekspressiooniandmed, geeniontoloogia)

learning_outcomes.en: 4)	Basic skills in in silico assembly of synthetic organisms in the Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL)- from hereditary material to metabolic pathways.
learning_outcomes.et: 4)	 Sünteetiliste geneetiliste süsteemide disain keskkonnas SBOL (Synthetic Biology Open Language).- DNA järjestusest metabolismi radadeni.

independent_work.et: Homeworks assigned by the lecturers and supervisors

debt_elimination.et: Homeworks resubmitted. Re-take of the exam

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

I - Introductory bioinformatics module
*	In silico analysis of single genes and proteins - basic search algorithms (blast), retrieval options, file types, alignment options, phylogenetic tree building etc.
*	Design of primers for single genes - PCR primers, cDNA cloning primers
*	Analysis of genomic regions - enhancers, promoters, coding regions, intron-exon. structure, (alternative) splicing, overlapping genes (including miRNA genes)
*	Analysis of gene expression data (RNA seq, microarray, protein arrays, chip data).
*	Analysis of interactome and GO data.
*	Analysis of protein interaction networks.

Letures and practice
II - Genome engineering module
*	The Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL): a community standard for communicating designs in synthetic biology.
*	Sequence manipulations, genome editing, codon optimization
*	In silico implementation of synthetic gene networks and functional modules based on genetic information from various species
*	Design of synthetic protein interaction networks using the Short Linear Motif (SLiMs) databases
*	Design of logic gates - outreach to computer engineering
*	In silico protein engineering
*	Assembly of heterologous biosynthetic pathways in cell factory producer strains and cell lines; integrating across the Design-Build-Test-Cycle.
*	Bioinformatics for the synthetic biology of natural products.

Letures and practice
III - Build-a-genome-course pre-planning module:
